website_summaries.verdict: Lightweight comfort at a great price.
pros: This little jacket is designed to protect you from cold winds using Toray Tyono 30 fabric and its fitted hood design
The durable water repellent finish provides decent moisture protection, and this jacket is flexible and quiet
cons: Doesn't provide the same protection as most Arc'teryx jackets

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, packable wind and water protection
customer_reviews.text: A couple years ago, I bought a Patagonia Houdini for outdoor concerts, emergency (summer) weather protection, and for hiking and running in the rain, but wasn't too happy with it. I saw this on sale, bought it on a whim, and have been happy ever since. For lightweight, packable wind and water protection, you can't get any better. Note: It is not designed nor is advertised for all-day deluges (get a Gore Tex equivalent shell that requirement, because this jacket will soak through after a prolonged downpour). Bottom line: I pack this when I go to summer music festivals or hiking/trail running if there is a threat of rain.
customer_reviews.author: RDB

customer_reviews.title: The perfect compromise for me.
customer_reviews.text: It's not totally waterproof. It's not totally windproof. It mitigates everything, though, and is very breathable and the stretch is nice. Because it helps in so many situations without ever being too much, I find myself using it all the time. Sure, occasionally I wish I had an umbrella or a more definitive wind blocker, but really it's not that often. Has the features I like, and doesn't have stuff I wouldn't use. Packs down nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Grey

customer_reviews.title: All stars, a perfect  all around  jacket
customer_reviews.text: Wow, beautiful threading, and made from high quality materials. The outer layer feels and looks much better than other light weight, water resistance, jackets (other top brands usually made of cheaper materials with glossy coating to resist water, and often create a rubbing sound). Not this - no glossy coating, no rubbing sound. Arcteryx Squamish is the perfect, light weight, durable, jacket for cross training, hiking, and any other outdoor activities. I have an appreciation for great industrial designs, and the Arcteryx Squamish delivered! This is now my “Go-To” jacket to the fitness center in cold weather, and pretty much all of my outdoor activities.
customer_reviews.author: GoLong

customer_reviews.title: Best UL hiking jacket there is.
customer_reviews.text: This is probably my favorite hiking jacket. I took in on the PCT and it was super light, packed compactly, and most of all it was a great wind breaker or (very) light thermal barrier without making me clammy. I bought a UL DWR jacket on the trail and tried to do without this one, but the (expensive) DWR jacket I tried to replace this one with got clammy so fast in comparison. This is my grab every time no-matter-what jacket for hiking. I won't leave home without it. Realize, there are no pockets - those create more weight.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Brown

customer_reviews.title: Fits great, looks great
customer_reviews.text: My original review was written in 2015. I still love this and consider it an excellent piece of gear. It has held up well and seen use ranging from traveling in Europe to backpacking in Alaska. If something happened to mine, I would by another one. Original review Fits great, looks great, feels durable. While there are cheaper wind jackets out there I'm glad I got this one. It looks good enough that I don't mind using it as a light jacket around town. Works great as an outer layer for running and packs small enough to be carried easily.
customer_reviews.author: Goat

customer_reviews.title: Durable Windebreaker Sheds Heavy Mist and Light Rain.
customer_reviews.text: Great windbreaker, works well in heavy mist or even light rain, for real rain you'll need a rain jacket, you'll also need a shirt or synthetic insulated vest if it's cold, but I go with that when hiking at altitude or on the coast on windy summer, early and late fall or late spring days. My last one held up for four years and some months. Worth the bucks. The new material is an ounce heavier but its unnoticeable!

product_meta.title: Arc'teryx Men's Squamish Hoody
product_meta.description: Arc'teryx Bottoms Size Chart Arc'teryx Tops Size Chart Biting winds can blow in at a moment's notice, ruining a day's climb or hike or turning your commute home into a ride into the beast's maw. The Squamish Hoodie has the high wind resistance you need while also packing down to almost nothing, so you can keep it nearby for the next time Mother Nature gets nasty. Athletic Fit:• Anatomical mapping and gussets improve range of motion by reducing excess fabric.• Allows room for an additional baselayer. Toray® Tyono™ 30 fabric:• Smooth, lightweight taffeta offers wind-resistant protection.• Highly compressible design packs into chest pocket.• Mechanical stretch offers full range of motion.• Denser, durable ripstop fabrication.• DWR (durable water repellent) finish for water-resistant protection. StormHood™ construction:• Helmet-compatible construction.• Laminated soft brim prevents moisture accumulation.• Four-point adjustability for secure fit without reducing visibility. #3 Vislon® front zip with inner draft flap. Long sleeves. Elastic-paneled cuffs with laminated hook-and-loop tabs. Zip chest pocket. Droptail hem with adjustable drawcord. 100% nylon. Machine wash and tumble dry. Imported. Measurements: Length: 29 in Product measurements were taken using size MD. Please note that measurements may vary by size.
feature_bullets: SQUAMISH HOODY MEN'S - Extremely light and compressible, this hooded windshell features ultralight minimalist construction and stows in the chest pocket for maximum packability.
ARC'ESSENTIALS - Versatile high performance designs for diverse activities and conditions.
BREATHABLE MATERIAL - Allows moisture vapour to escape, helping regulate temperature and elevating comfort inside garment.
